changelog: v2.0: Added ~37 new LBTESTCD codes (iron panel, renal biomarkers, cardiac markers, thyroid, hormones, immunology, urinalysis)

v2.0: Added ~80 new MI histopathology entries (necrosis, hypertrophy, hyperplasia, atrophy, degeneration, inflammation, fibrosis across additional organs; metaplasia, dysplasia, neoplasia, thrombus categories)
v2.0: Added 12 new OM organ weight entries (thyroid, pituitary, prostate, uterus, epididymis, pancreas)
v2.0: Fixed electrolyte PTs to include 'Blood' prefix per MedDRA convention (Na, K, Cl, Ca, Phos, Mg)
v2.0: Fixed 'Phosphate abnormal' to 'Blood phosphorus abnormal' (MedDRA uses 'phosphorus' not 'phosphate')
v2.0: Fixed 'Inflammation' SOC from 'Immune system disorders' to 'General disorders and administration site conditions'
v2.0: Fixed 'Hepatic enlargement' to 'Hepatomegaly' (correct MedDRA PT)
v2.0: Fixed 'Hepatic vacuolation' to 'Hepatocellular vacuolation'
v2.0: Fixed 'Hepatic degeneration' to 'Hepatocyte degeneration'
v2.0: Fixed 'Renal tubular apoptosis' to 'Renal tubular necrosis' (not a valid MedDRA PT)
v2.0: Fixed hormone 'abnormal' PTs to include 'Blood' prefix (Insulin, Cortisol, Thyroxine, TSH)
v2.0: Resolved 9 duplicate LBTESTCD pairs per CDISC NCI EVS C65047 (removed AMYL/LIP/TBIL/GLB/BAS/Eos/HCO3/CHO/TP)
v2.0: Removed non-standard LBTESTCD keys (KIDNEY, PLASMA, PHEN, CHOLIN, A_RATIO, TGTP, BILEAC, TGLOB)
v2.0: Standardized MI key format: removed legacy _ADRENAL suffix keys
v2.0: Added CRP condition PT as 'Acute phase reaction' (replacing 'Inflammation' with wrong SOC)
v2.1 (Stage 2): Added 'Liver injury' and 'Cholestatic liver injury' PTs to relevant hepatotoxicity markers
v2.1 (Stage 2): Fixed LDH mapping (non-organ-specific; now maps to Haemolytic anaemia)
v2.1 (Stage 2): Fixed globulin acute phase protein PTs to 'Acute phase reaction'
v2.1 (Stage 2): Fixed MI:INFLAMMATION:BONE_MARROW from Osteomyelitis to Bone marrow inflammation (non-infectious)
v2.1 (Stage 2): Fixed MI:INFLAMMATION:BRAIN to use non-infectious encephalitis terms
v2.1 (Stage 2): Fixed all 'Inflammatory cell infiltration' SOC to General disorders

v2.1 (Stage 2): Added ~80 new MI entries: missing organ×finding combos, INHAND-specific findings (phospholipidosis, EMH, single cell necrosis, hyaline droplets, centrilobular patterns), injection site reactions, skeletal muscle, neoplasia, demyelination/gliosis
v2.1 (Stage 2): Added ~12 new LBTESTCD codes (SAA, RETPCT, LUC, NLR, UOSM, UCAST, UCRYST, UEPITH, PREALB, BILDIR, BILIND)
v2.1 (Stage 2): Added OM:WEIGHT:SEMINAL_VESICLE:UP/DOWN
v2.1 (Stage 2): Made FIB bidirectional (up = acute phase; down = coagulopathy)
v2.1 (Stage 2): Added _note metadata to complex or uncertain entries
v3.0 (Stage 3): Standardized all OM Investigation PTs to 'Organ weight increased/decreased' (organ-specific weight PTs may only exist as LLTs)
v3.0 (Stage 3): Fixed OM:WEIGHT:THYMUS:UP from 'Thymomegaly' to 'Thymic hyperplasia' (validated PT)
v3.0 (Stage 3): Fixed OM:WEIGHT:PROSTATE:UP from 'Prostatomegaly' to 'Prostate enlarged'
v3.0 (Stage 3): Fixed OM:WEIGHT:KIDNEY:UP from 'Nephromegaly' to 'Renal hypertrophy'
v3.0 (Stage 3): Added OM entries for salivary gland and parathyroid gland
v3.0 (Stage 3): QC pass: deduplicated PTs, validated direction fields, checked MedDRA British spellings, verified key formats
sources: CDISC SEND Controlled Terminology (NCI EVS codelist C65047) - release 2025-03-28
CDISC SEND IG 3.1.1 (endpoint identifiers LBTESTCD; domains LB/MI/OM)
MedDRA v27.0 (Preferred Terms and Primary SOCs)
MedDRA Term Selection: Points to Consider (Release 4.22)
CTCAE v5.0 (NCI Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events — MedDRA mappings)
INHAND (International Harmonization of Nomenclature and Diagnostic Criteria for Lesions in Rats and Mice)
INHAND (International Harmonization of Nomenclature and Diagnostic Criteria) — Hepatobiliary, Urinary, Cardiovascular, Endocrine, GI, Hematolymphoid system publications
MedDRA Introductory Guide v25.0 (liver injury PT classification guidance)
CDISC SEND Controlled Terminology 2025-03-28 (NCI EVS - OM domain organ list)
notes: VALIDATION CAVEAT: MedDRA is proprietary and the full dictionary is only available to licensed subscribers (MSSO). This mapping was constructed from publicly available fragments — BioPortal, CTCAE v5.0 crosswalks, MedDRA Introductory Guides, pharmacovigilance literature, and MedDRA naming conventions. Common PTs (e.g. Hepatomegaly, Blood glucose increased) are high-confidence (~90%+). The 17 entries flagged with _note metadata are medium/lower confidence (~50-70%) where PTs were inferred from naming patterns rather than confirmed in a licensed browser. Before wiring into production concordance scoring, spot-check all PTs against a licensed MedDRA v27.0 distribution: search each PT string, confirm it exists as a PT (not just an LLT), and verify the primary SOC assignment.
PT and SOC strings should be validated against your licensed MedDRA v27.0 distribution.
Lab test keys are SEND LBTESTCD codes per NCI EVS C65047.
Histopathology keys are MI-qualified as MI:<FINDING>:<ORGAN>.
Organ weights are OM-qualified as OM:WEIGHT:<ORGAN>:UP|DOWN.
Entries with '_note' fields contain verification guidance for PTs with medium or lower confidence.
Novel renal biomarker PTs (KIM1, NGAL, NAG) may only exist in MedDRA v24.0+; verify in licensed browser.
Electrolyte and hormone Investigation PTs follow MedDRA's 'Blood [analyte] [qualifier]' convention.
OM Investigation PTs use generic 'Organ weight increased/decreased' — organ-specific weight PTs (e.g. 'Liver weight increased') may only exist as LLTs in MedDRA.
All terms use MedDRA British/INN spellings: anaemia (not anemia), oedema (not edema), haemorrhage (not hemorrhage), oestradiol (not estradiol).

KIM1._note: FDA/EMA-qualified biomarker; PT may have been added in MedDRA v24.0+

LDH._note: LDH elevation is non-organ-specific; may indicate hemolysis, hepatocellular injury, or myocardial injury depending on isoenzyme

NAG._note: Urinary biomarker; Investigation PT may exist only as LLT in some MedDRA versions

NGAL._note: Investigation PT may not exist as a distinct PT; verify in licensed MedDRA browser

pts.soc: General disorders and administration site conditions

NLR._note: NLR is a derived parameter; may not have an official CDISC LBTESTCD

MI:CENTRILOBULAR HYPERTROPHY:LIVER._note: Centrilobular hypertrophy is the most common drug-induced liver finding; often adaptive and associated with enzyme induction

pts.soc: General disorders and administration site conditions
General disorders and administration site conditions

MI:FOLLICULAR CELL HYPERTROPHY:THYROID._note: Thyroid follicular cell hypertrophy is a common adaptive response to hepatic enzyme induction reducing circulating T4

MI:HEPATOCELLULAR NECROSIS:LIVER._note: Distinct from MI:NECROSIS:LIVER; specifies hepatocellular origin

MI:HYALINE DROPLETS:KIDNEY._note: Hyaline droplet accumulation in proximal tubules; species-specific (rat males); alpha-2u globulin nephropathy

MI:INFLAMMATION:BONE_MARROW._note: Bone marrow inflammation may map to Osteomyelitis if infectious; use Bone marrow inflammation for drug-induced

pts.soc: General disorders and administration site conditions
General disorders and administration site conditions
General disorders and administration site conditions

MI:INFLAMMATION:LYMPH_NODE._note: Drug-induced lymph node inflammation may present as reactive hyperplasia; Lymphadenitis typically implies infectious etiology

pts.soc: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)
Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)
General disorders and administration site conditions
Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

MI:SINGLE CELL NECROSIS:LIVER._note: INHAND recommends 'single cell necrosis' over 'apoptosis'; both may coexist

MI:STELLATE CELL HYPERTROPHY:LIVER._note: May not have an exact MedDRA PT; closest is hepatic fibrosis pathway activation

MI:VACUOLATION:ADRENAL._note: Cortical vacuolation often indicates lipid accumulation; common adaptive/toxic finding

OM:WEIGHT:SALIVARY_GLAND:UP._note: Salivary glands weighed in some rat protocols; not always standard

OM:WEIGHT:THYMUS:UP._note: Thymomegaly may exist as LLT; Thymic hyperplasia is the safer PT
